a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Price changes in consumer goods and services in the United States
Price change in consumer goods and services in the United States, measured as the percentage change since
1997. Data is based on the consumer price index (CPI) for national average urban consumer prices.
Data source: United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS)
Note: Some services, such as medical care, are not adjusted for quality. When adjusted for quality, some treatments have decreased in
